title: 110_s547
content: The Act titled "Effective Homeland Security Management Act of 2007" establishes the position of Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to establish two Deputy Secretaries of Homeland Security and outlines procedures for vacancies in the office of the Secretary. The Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security can exercise the duties of the Secretary in case of absence or disability. If both the Secretary and Deputy Secretary are unavailable, the Deputy Secretary for Management will act as Secretary. In case of a vacancy in the office of the Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security, procedures are outlined. In the event of a vacancy or absence of the Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security, the Deputy Secretary for Management can assume the duties of the office. The Secretary has the authority to designate other officers in further succession to act as Secretary. The Deputy Secretary for Management serves as the Chief Management Officer and principal advisor. The Deputy Secretary for Management serves as the Chief Management Officer and principal advisor on matters related to the management of the Department, including integration and transformation in support of homeland security operations and programs. Strategic planning, annual performance planning, and tracking of performance measures are key responsibilities. The text discusses the integration and transformation process within the Department of Homeland Security, specifically focusing on the appointment, evaluation, and reappointment of the Deputy Secretary for Management. The amendments include changes in titles and roles to ensure efficient consolidation of functions and personnel. The Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management is appointed by the President with Senate approval, based on leadership experience, skills, ability to manage organizations, and achieving positive results. They serve a 5-year term and can be removed by the President for performance reasons. The President can remove the Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management if their performance is unsatisfactory, and must communicate the reasons to Congress. The Deputy Secretary can be reappointed if their performance is satisfactory for the 3 most recent years, and must have an annual performance agreement with measurable goals. The Secretary evaluates their performance annually. The Under Secretary for Management of the Department of Homeland Security may temporarily perform the duties of the Deputy Secretary for Management until a new Deputy Secretary is appointed. The Deputy Secretary must make satisfactory progress towards goals set in their performance agreement, evaluated annually by the Secretary. The Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management may be appointed in accordance with the Homeland Security Act of 2002. References to the Under Secretary for Management shall now refer to the Deputy Secretary. Amendments have been made to reflect this change in the Homeland Security Act. The table of contents in the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to replace the item relating to section 701 with new information. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security for Management in the Executive schedule.
